scenario_tester.title: Scenario Tester
scenario_tester.or_create_custom: Or create a custom one below
scenario_tester.regenerate_hands_tooltip: For predefined scenarios only. Generates new random hands that fit the scenario's rules.
scenario_tester.no_result: Run a test to see the result.
scenario_tester.run_simulations_no_scenario_error: Please select a predefined scenario to run bulk simulations.

parda_y_gano.title: Parda y Gano (Tie and Win)
parda_y_gano.description: The first trick was a tie. The AI is hand for the second and holds a strong hand. The goal is for the AI to recognize that winning this trick wins the round and to call Truco for maximum points.

do_or_die.title: Do-or-Die
do_or_die.description: The AI is about to lose the game. The opponent calls Truco. Folding is a certain loss. The AI must ignore its hand weakness and accept, as it's its only chance to win.

lopsided_bait.title: Lopsided Hand Bait
lopsided_bait.description: The AI has a very high Envido (31+) but very poor cards for Truco. The optimal strategy is to not call Envido and play a low card, hoping the opponent calls so it can be counter-attacked.

envido_primero.title: Envido Primero
envido_primero.description: The opponent calls Truco. The AI has an excellent Envido (33+). The correct rule/strategy is to interrupt with 'Envido is first' to secure those points before resolving the Truco.

flor_vs_envido.title: Flor vs. Envido
flor_vs_envido.description: The opponent calls Envido. The AI has Flor. The rule is that Flor voids and beats Envido, so the AI must respond with 'Flor'.

endgame_pressure_truco.title: Endgame Pressure
endgame_pressure_truco.description: The AI is about to win (14 points). It has a decent but not unbeatable hand. The goal is for the AI to play conservatively and avoid calling Truco, not risking the game unnecessarily.

explanations.accept_contraflor_strong: The AI's Flor score is very high, giving it confidence to accept the Contraflor challenge.
explanations.accept_envido_good_odds: The AI's Envido score is close to or better than the opponent's estimated score, making 'Quiero' a profitable call.
explanations.accept_envido_hero_call: Although the AI's Envido is weak, it's making a 'hero call' based on game pressure or a suspicion that the opponent is bluffing.
explanations.accept_envido_slow_play: The AI has a monster Envido hand (32+) and is accepting instead of escalating, hoping to trap the opponent into a false sense of security for the Truco phase.
explanations.accept_truco_bluff_call: The AI is accepting a weak hand ('calling the bluff') because game pressure is high or it suspects the opponent is bluffing.
explanations.accept_truco_decent_equity: The AI's calculated win probability ('equity') is positive, making 'Quiero' a rational, value-based decision.
explanations.accept_truco_do_or_die: The AI is forced to accept. Declining the Truco would mean losing the game, so accepting is its only chance to win, regardless of hand strength.
explanations.accept_truco_lookahead_fold: The AI initially considered escalating to 'Retruco' but a lookahead simulation showed it would likely fold to a 'Vale Cuatro'. It chose the safer 'Quiero'.
explanations.accept_truco_mixed: The decision was on the edge. The AI used a mixed strategy and randomly chose to accept.
explanations.accept_truco_solid: The AI's hand is solid (50th percentile or higher), making 'Quiero' a standard and safe response to an early Truco.
explanations.acknowledge_flor: The AI does not have Flor, so its only legal move is to acknowledge the opponent's Flor.
explanations.bait_lopsided_hand: The AI has a strong Envido but weak Truco. It's playing a low card to hide its Envido, hoping the opponent will call so it can be counter-attacked with Real Envido or Falta Envido.
explanations.call_contraflor: The AI has Flor and the opponent also has Flor. The AI is escalating the bet to 'Contraflor'.
explanations.call_envido_bluff: The AI has low Envido but is bluffing, based on game pressure or the opponent's high fold rate.
explanations.call_envido_marginal: The AI's Envido is mediocre (26-27). It's making a borderline call based on the game situation.
explanations.call_envido_strong: The AI's Envido is strong (28+), so it's making a value bet to win the points.
explanations.call_falta_defensive: The AI is about to lose the game if the opponent wins the Envido points. It's calling 'Falta Envido' as a desperate defensive play.
explanations.call_falta_win_game: The AI has a strong Envido and the points from 'Falta Envido' are enough to win the game.
explanations.call_flor: The AI has three cards of the same suit, so it is obligated to call 'Flor'.
explanations.call_real_dominant: The AI's Envido is dominant (31+). It's calling 'Real Envido' to maximize points.
explanations.call_truco_bluff: The AI has a weak Truco hand but is bluffing, based on the situation or the opponent model.
explanations.call_truco_certain_win: The AI has deduced that it has the round won for certain (e.g., holds the highest remaining card) and is escalating the Truco to maximize points.
explanations.call_truco_parda_y_gano: The first trick was a tie. The AI knows that if it wins the second trick, it wins the round. It is calling 'Truco' before playing its winning card, a no-risk value bet.
explanations.call_truco_post_parda_bluff: The first trick was a tie. The AI's hand is weak, but it's bluffing 'Truco' to exploit the pressure of the situation.
explanations.call_truco_value: The AI's simulated win probability ('strength') is high. It's calling 'Truco' as a standard value bet.
explanations.call_truco_won_trick1: The AI won the first trick, giving it a positional advantage. It's calling 'Truco' to press this advantage.
explanations.decline_contraflor_weak: The AI's Flor score is too low to compete in a 'Contraflor', so it is folding.
explanations.decline_envido_bluff_fold: The AI has a very weak hand and suspects the opponent is not bluffing. It's folding to minimize losses.
explanations.decline_envido_weak: The AI's Envido score is low and the odds of winning the showdown are poor.
explanations.decline_truco_certain_loss: The AI's simulation shows a near-zero win probability. It's folding to avoid losing more points.
explanations.decline_truco_impossible: The AI has determined that it is mathematically impossible to win the round, so it is folding.
explanations.decline_truco_low_equity: The AI's calculated win probability ('equity') is negative, making folding the rational play.
explanations.decline_truco_mixed: The decision was on the edge. The AI used a mixed strategy and randomly chose to fold.
explanations.decline_truco_weak: The AI's hand is weak (bottom 50th percentile) and there are not enough incentives to attempt a bluff.
explanations.discard_low: The AI cannot win the current trick, so it is playing its lowest card to save better ones for later tricks.
explanations.escalate_envido_bluff: The AI is bluffing by raising to 'Envido-Envido', hoping the opponent will fold.
explanations.escalate_envido_strong: The AI's Envido score is strong enough to justify a re-raise to 'Envido-Envido'.
explanations.escalate_falta_win_game: The AI has a very strong Envido hand and the points from 'Falta Envido' are enough to win the game.
explanations.escalate_real_bluff: The AI is bluffing by raising to 'Real Envido', hoping to intimidate the opponent into folding.
explanations.escalate_real_stronger: The AI believes its Envido score is significantly higher than the opponent's and is escalating to 'Real Envido' for value.
explanations.escalate_truco_bluff: The AI is bluffing by escalating to 'Retruco' or 'Vale Cuatro' with a weak hand.
explanations.escalate_truco_desperation_bluff: The AI has a near-zero win probability but is attempting a desperate bluff to steal the round.
explanations.escalate_truco_dominant_card: The AI holds a dominant final card and is escalating the bet, knowing it's almost certain to win.
explanations.escalate_truco_elite: The AI's hand is in the 90th percentile or higher. It is escalating the Truco with confidence.
explanations.escalate_truco_high_equity: The AI's calculated win probability ('equity') is very high, justifying an escalation.
explanations.escalate_truco_mixed_bluff: The decision was on the edge. The AI used a mixed strategy and randomly chose to escalate with a bluff.
explanations.escalate_truco_strong: The AI's hand is in the 75th percentile or higher. It has a reasonable chance to escalate.
explanations.escalate_truco_weak_bluff: The AI's hand is weak, but it's attempting a risky bluff due to game pressure.
explanations.feint_active_truco: The AI has a monster hand and Truco is already called. It's playing a low card to appear weak and bait the opponent into re-raising ('Retruco').
explanations.feint_pre_truco: The AI has a monster Truco hand. Instead of calling 'Truco' immediately, it's playing a low card as bait to hide its strength and tempt the opponent to call.
explanations.parda_y_canto: The AI can tie the current trick and has a very strong card saved. It chooses to tie to hide its strength and call 'Truco' on the next trick.
explanations.play_last_card: It's the final trick, and the AI has only one card left to play.
explanations.probe_envido_hide: The AI has a strong Envido and is playing an unrelated card to hide which suit forms its Envido.
explanations.probe_low_value: The AI is playing its lowest card. This is a probing move to see what the opponent plays without risking a strong card. It's often used when the AI is not 'mano' (playing second) or to set up a bait.
explanations.probe_mid_value: The AI is playing its middle card. This is a more convincing bait, hiding both its strongest and weakest card.
explanations.probe_sacrificial: The AI holds the Ace of Swords and another top-tier card. It is 'sacrificing' the second-best card to appear strong but beatable, hoping for a Truco escalation.
explanations.respond_truco_with_flor: The opponent called Truco, but the AI has Flor. Flor has priority and must be declared.
explanations.respond_with_contraflor: The opponent called Flor, and the AI also has Flor. The AI is responding with 'Contraflor'.
explanations.respond_with_flor: The opponent called Envido, but the AI has Flor. Flor voids and beats Envido, so the AI is declaring it.
explanations.secure_hand: The AI is playing its strongest available card to try and secure the current trick.
explanations.unknown_action: The action does not match a predefined reason key.
explanations.win_round_cheap: The AI can win the current trick and is using the weakest possible card to do so, saving stronger cards for later.
